result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Edward J Fletcher

records.addlTxt: letter from Defendant and response letter from Judge

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
9:39 a.m. Defendant Edward J Fletcher in court with attorney John H. Wallace. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases: 13CF474, 14CF336, 15CF203, 15CF140, 13TR5127.
  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement and will file an amended information for 13CF474.
 (amend 13CF474 to add felony I 943.20(3)(bf) penalty enhancer:) Probation w/conditions. 14CF336 to be DRI.

Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
Case 15CF140 Preliminary hearing waived and Arraignment held.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
13CF474 amended:  No Contest
15CF203 Count 3: No Contest
15CF140 Count 1: No Contest
13TR5127: Stip & Order filed and signed by parties.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

Court reviews victim impact statement.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 13CF474 as amended, 15CF140 Ct 1, 15CF203 Ct 3, and 13TR5127.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
 Dimissed and read in 14CF336,  15CF140 Ct 2, 15CF203 ct 1 & 2.

ADA Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Wallace concurs in part and request expungment.
ADA Cousins doesn't object if all restitution and cost are paid. 

BY THE COURT:****
13TR5127: Stip & Order filed and signed by the Court

15CF140 Ct 1: W/H Sentence: 5 yrs Probation
Conditions: (same as 13CF474)
Pay costs & DNA surcharge. 
If successfully completes probation with all restitution in 13CF474 paid in full (even though it is joint and several) and must be recommended by the Agent for expungement.

15CF203 Ct 3:W/H Sentence: 5 yrs Probation
Conditions: (same as 13CF474)
Pay costs & DNA surcharge.
If successfully completes probation with all restitution in 13CF474 paid in full (even though it is joint and several) and must be recommended by the Agent for expungement.

13CF474 amended:  
W/H Sentence: 5 yrs Probation
Conditions:
180 days jail, (zero days credit).  Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department. 1/2 on electronic monitor if 
Defendant is eligible for Electronic Monitoring if approved by the risk assessment and jail administration.
Pay restitution J/S several of $19,017.63,
  Engage and comply in any other counseling reasonably related to the offense as recommended by the Agent.
  Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment as approved by the Agent
  Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
 Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time as approved by the Agent.
Apology letter give to agent w/in 60 days and may forward if appropriate.
If successfully completes probation with all restitution in 13CF474 paid in full (even though it is joint and several) and must be recommended by the Agent for expungement.
Pay costs.
Provide DNA sample.

Prior: 1430 Torun Road #106, Stevens Point, WI 54481

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Edward J Fletcher in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 13CF474, 14CF336, 15CF140, 13TR5127
9:50 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

Atty Cousins has spoken with Atty Zenor.  2 new files in Portage County and Marathon County.  The agreement reached is no longer appropriate.  Atty Halverson is representing the defendant on the new files. Asks that these files be set for a pre-trial on 7/20 at 10:00 with the new files that are set on that time.  Atty Zenor is not sure of her status.  
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes. No victims are present. 
Court advises defendant of right to make a statement but can be used against him in the future. 
(Defendant consults with Atty Halverson)
Court advises the defendant of the pre-trial conference.  
Defendant does not object to the adjournment.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on February 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Edward J Fletcher in court with attorney Sandra J. Zenor.  Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

8:39 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.
Case to be pre-tried today; Atty Cousins to file pre-trial report.

BY THE COURT:
Bond Continued.

Defendant Edward J Fletcher in court with attorney Sandra J. Zenor. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Cousins asks the Court to take Judicial Notice of the bond in 13CF474.
BY THE COURT:  Judicial Notice taken.

Officer S. Spath is called and sworn.
Direct exam by Atty Cousins. 
Witness identifies the defendant.
Exhibit #1 is marked on behalf of the plaintiff. 

Atty Cousins moves for the admission of Exhibit #1. 
BY THE COURT:  Exhibit #1 is received. 

Direct exam continues by Atty Cousins. 
Cross exam by Atty Zenor.

BY THE COURT:  Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.
  
State files information. 
  
BY THE COURT:  Bond and conditions of bond are continued.
Preliminary hearing on October 6, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Edward J Fletcher in court with attorney Sandra J. Zenor. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.

BY THE COURT:  Bond Continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 6, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  *Eli J Cruz or his residence*  Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.  Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. Comply with conditions of bond in  13CF-474.

DA Molepske appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

1:16 PM Court calls case.

DA Molepske states facts for anticipated charges of Disorderly Conduct.

Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.

Court questions Defendant. 
Atty Molepske states that Defendant is on bond currently in 13CF-474.

State requests a $150 cash bond  with conditions as stated.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:    September 08, 2014 @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 2
